item.title: All in one beginner tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Sync Sync
item.description:
@Sync wrote:

I get it, and if I was to make two words appear it would be like this:

[code]program New;

const
Message1=‘Hello world!’;
Message2=‘It Works!’;

procedure Script;
begin
wait(1000)
Writeln(Message1);
Writeln(Message2);
end;

begin
repeat
Script
until(false)
end.[/code]
But if I wanted them both to come in at different times it would be like this:

[code]program New;

const
Message1=‘Hello world!’;
Message2=‘It Works!’;

procedure Script;
begin
wait(1000)
Writeln(Message1);
wait(1000)
Writeln(Message2);
end;

begin
repeat
Script
until(false)
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: All in one beginner tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

You need a semi-colon after your “const” statement.

Message1='Hello world!';

Like that.

Read full topic
